definition: to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
to have nothing to say (idiom)
malicious
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
openly and without fear/brazenly
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
clumsy/all thumbs
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
(usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
you're welcome/don't mention it/impolite/rude/blunt
to lose face/humiliation
